title.narrative: Enhancing the impact of continental responses to peace and human security challenges

description.narrative: African Union (AU) Peace and Security Council AU Permanent Representatives Committee AU Peace and Security and Political Affairs Depts. Councellors & technical officers to African Ambassadors, and Committee of Experts to the PSC COuntry officers, and RECs liaison officers to the AU Addis Ababa policy community

Outcome 1: Enhanced capacity of key decision-makers to respond to critical conflict and crisis issues on the continent;
Outcome 2: Enhanced broad-base knowledge of conflict dynamics by peace, security and political actors in the Addis Ababa community;
The APSD aims at enhancing African (continental) decision makers' capacity for effective conflict prevention, early warning, mediation, peacebuilding and post conflict restruction efforts.

participating-org.narrative: Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS)
Institute for Peace and Security Studies (IPSS)
United Nations Office for West Africa and Sahel (UNOWAS)

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

description.narrative: Contract with the State of the Netherlands represented by the Minister of Foreign Trade and Development Cooperation

title.narrative: Closed Regional Consultations with PRC and PSC Ambassadors, Counsellors, Representatives of the AU, and members of the African diplomatic community in Addis Ababa

description.narrative: Closed regional consultations on specific regional issue to enhance policy stakeholders' understanding of the dynamics and how to respond to those issues.

title.narrative: consultations held and key recommendations shared

description.narrative: number of closed regional consultations held

comment.narrative: 2 regional consultations on Southern Africa and the Sahel, focussed on the prevailing peace and security challenges in those regions.

Organized two regional consultations on Violent Exremism in Southern Africa to share lessons learned in dealing with the situation in other regions. And the regional consultation on the Sahel focused on the security situation in the region.
The ISS organized a closed briefing on the AU-European Union strategy. The briefing focused on the negotiations of the AU-European Union strategy
The ISS organized a closed briefing on the AU-European Union strategy. The briefing focused on the negotiations of the AU-European Union strategy

title.narrative: Regional dialogues on the impact of various actions on regional peace, security and governance issues to enhance response efforts

description.narrative: Closed regional consultations with inter-governmental organisation like the IGAD, ECCAS, ECOWAS, to engage on better ways to address regional conflict dynmics

title.narrative: consultations held and key recommendations shared

comment.narrative: 2 regions discussed and recommendations shared
A regional consultation (Webinar) on the Horn of Africa was carried out, and one on the Sahel is being planned

title.narrative: Increased Support to the African Union on peace and security initiatives

description.narrative: Contributed to supporting AU's initiative of peace and security processes

title.narrative: Roundtables and retreat organized for key stakeholders and Policy makers

comment.narrative: The ISS organized a capacity building training on M&E for the AU PSC secretariat. The ISS organized a series of 6 meetings jointly with the AU PSC Secretariat to develop the M&E Framework. The ISS, jointly with the AU PSC secretariat organized a retreat for the AU PSC Committee of Experts to finalize and consider the M&E.

title.narrative: Support to AU's initiatives

comment.narrative: Support in promoting AU's Peace and Security initiatives

The ISS led a team of CSO actors to submit a paper on “Silencing the Guns in Africa: Achievements, Challenges and Prospects” as CSO input into the AU’s assessment of the STG initiative. The Sudan peace process workshops and transitional justice initially requested by the AU have been postponed at their request.
Support in promoting AU's Peace and Security initiatives

The ISS led a team of CSO actors to submit a paper on “Silencing the Guns in Africa: Achievements, Challenges and Prospects” as CSO input into the AU’s assessment of the STG initiative. The Sudan peace process workshops and transitional justice initially requested by the AU have been postponed at their request.

The ISS supported the AU AGA secretariat in the preparation of the AU 9th High-Level Dialogue and the pre-events. The ISS was requested by the AU to develop a monitoring and evaluation framework on the silencing the guns roadmap The ISS also supported the AU PSC Secretariat in publishing the AU PSC’s Working Methods document as a handbook for PSC members

The ISS supported the AU AGA secretariat in the preparation of the AU 9th High-Level Dialogue and the pre-events. The ISS was requested by the AU to develop a monitoring and evaluation framework on the silencing the guns roadmap The ISS also supported the AU PSC Secretariat in publishing the AU PSC’s Working Methods document as a handbook for PSC members

title.narrative: Development of a policy paper on enhancing coordination and synergy between the African Governance Architecture (AGA) and the African Peace and Security Architecture (APSA)

description.narrative: Developed a policy paper in support of AGA-APSA secretariat in enhancing complimentarity and synergy between the two architectures

title.narrative: Policy paper on enhancing coordibation and synergy between the AGA and APSA Architectures

comment.narrative: Finalized the first Draft of the policy paper on enhancing coordination and synergy between the African Governance Architecture (AGA) and the African Peace and Security architecture (APSA)

title.narrative: Developed an Implementation Plan for the M&E framework on the Silencing the Guns Initiative

description.narrative: Developed an Implementation Plan for the M&E framework on Silencing the Guns in support of the AU Silencing the Guns Unit in monitoring and tracking progress on the implementation of the Silencing the Guns Initiative in Africa

title.narrative: Technical Support to the AU Silencing the Guns Unit

comment.narrative: The ISS in collaboration with the AU Silencing the Guns Unit, organized series of meetings online to develop the Implementation Plan for M&E framework on the STG initiative and also organized a validation workshop to review and adopt the document

title.narrative: Development of an M&E framework for the AU's Master Roadmap on Silencing the Guns in Africa by 2030.

description.narrative: Developed an M&E framework in support of the AU PSC Secretariat's monitoring work on the implementation of the Silencing the Guns Initiative in Africa

title.narrative: M&E framework for silencing the guns in Africa initiative

comment.narrative: Finalized the M&E framework on silencing the guns which was later adopted by the AU PSC secretariat in June

title.narrative: Increased conflict prevention support to key AU departments (PSD, DPA and Office of the Chairperson)

description.narrative: Not previewed in project, however direct support was requested by AU departments, beyond the decision-making organs

title.narrative: roundtables and meetings organised

comment.narrative: Supported the AU to to organise the PSD's Structural Vulnerability Assessment and CSVRA workshop; CEWS to organise a seminar on Somalia / Alshabaab insurgency and the effects of the winding down of AMISOM,

title.narrative: Informed broad base understanding of AU's new leadership, continental challenges in Human Security and priority areas for the AU in 2021

description.narrative: Open consultations to provide understanding to the diplomatic community and other key stakeholders of the AU's new leadership, challenges in peace and security and AU's priority areas in 2021

title.narrative: public seminars organised for key stakeholders and policymakers

comment.narrative: The ISS organized two open webinars related to the AU summit. The first was the Pre-AU summit webinar which focused on the challenges in 2020 including the COVID-19 pandemic, extension of silencing the guns initiative and the dynamics around the AU elections. The second was the Post-AU summit which focused on the outcomes of the 34th AU ordinary summit, priorities of the DRC as the AU chair in 2021 and the AU-RECs relationship in addressing peace and security challenges in the continent.

title.narrative: Informed broad base understanding of continental challenges in Human Security and priority areas for the AU in 2022

description.narrative: Open consultations to provide understanding to the diplomatic community and other key stakeholders of the continental challenges in peace and security and AU's priority areas in 2022

title.narrative: Public seminars organized for key stakeholders and policy makers

comment.narrative: The ISS organized two open webinars related to the AU summit - (1) The Pre-AU summit webinar reflected on the extent to which the AU will be able to address continental challenges in the context of the prevailing governance, peace and security realities. (2) The Post-AU summit webinar discussed the emerging issues from the 35th AU ordinary summit and the implications on the continent's peace and stability.

title.narrative: Thematic consultations to reflect on key challenges in securing common African Positions on continental and global issues

description.narrative: Thematic consultations to build the technical capacity of policy actors to address key challenges in securing and implementing Common African Positions on continental and global issues.

title.narrative: consultations held and key recommendations shared

comment.narrative: 2 thematic consultation focusing on the challenges of securing common African positions

Organized a High-level Webinar on Common African positions: achievable goal or wishful thinking? which focused on the challenges to crafting and securing Common African Positions on global and continental issues.
2 thematic consultation focusing on the challenges of securing common African positions

Organized a High-level Webinar on Common African positions: achievable goal or wishful thinking? which focused on the challenges to crafting and securing Common African Positions on global and continental issues.

title.narrative: Formal and informal briefings are delivered to PSC, PRC, Councellors and Committee of experts on crisis issues

description.narrative: These are all the briefing sessions delivered to key decision making organs in the AU and thier support units

title.narrative: Briefing sessions to the PSC, PRC, Councillors and CoE

comment.narrative: Project didnt exist
6 events were envisaged - 2 each with the PSC, PRC and Counselors
Nine formal and informal briefings were made

title.narrative: Briefings are delivered to other relevant national, regional and international stakeholders and partners

description.narrative: These are all the briefing sessions delivered to stakeholders other than the key AU leadership which still influences AU decision-making. E.g. non-African diplomatic missions, RECs, etc

title.narrative: briefing sessions to other stakeholders

description.narrative: Number of briefing sessions delivered to other stakeholders

comment.narrative: these are by-products of the project, which although didnt set out to, but invariably briefed numerous non decision makers
PSC Committee of Experts, various non African diplomatic missions, RECs and Liaison offices to the AU,

title.narrative: Induction meetings to new PSC members organised

description.narrative: These are briefings to new PSC member countries elected to serve on the Council

title.narrative: Courtesy calls to new PSC members

comment.narrative: Project didnt exist
A single event was to be organised but this was not politically possible
4 key PSC members were briefed individually

title.narrative: Country consultations for improved understanding and response options of specific country dynamics

description.narrative: These are consultations devoted to specific country crisis issues with key AU and national actors

title.narrative: consultations held and key recommendations shared

comment.narrative: 2 countries discussed and recommendations shared
Closed consultations held on Sudan and South Sudan

title.narrative: Thematic consultations in support of AU peace and security continental initiatives and normative frameworks

description.narrative: These are consultations with key continental stakeholders to enhance the African Union’s delivery on key peace and security initiatives

title.narrative: consultations held and key recommendations shared

comment.narrative: Consultations held on any 2 thematic issues
Consultations held on CSO contribution to the theme of the Year, and Workshop on Transitional Justice.

title.narrative: Enhanced understanding of the AU Technical Experts on Terrorism and Unconstitutional Changes of Government

description.narrative: To provide analysis and policy recommendations to key policy makers on terrorism and Unconstitutional Changes of Government

title.narrative: Closed briefing organized for Technical Experts

comment.narrative: The ISS organized a dinner for the Technical Experts to engage and discuss issues of terrorism and unconstitutional changes of government. The objective of the dinner was to discuss issues of terrorism, violent extremism and unconstitutional changes of government given the importance of the subject ahead of the upcoming AU extraordinary summit held on 28 May 2022 in Malabo.

title.narrative: Enhanced knowledge and understanding among key stakeholders on Maritime Security on the Continent

description.narrative: To provide analysis and policy recommendations to key stakeholders on issues of Maritime Security on the continent.

title.narrative: Conference organized for key stakeholders and policy makers

comment.narrative: The ISS in collaboration with the Nigerian Navy organized a maritime conference. The objective was to interrogate and agree upon the modalities for fulfilling the requirements of AU PSC communiqué 1012, AU Assembly Decision 755 and the 2050 Maritime Strategy

title.narrative: Enhanced understanding and knowledge among policy makers on the issues ofUnconstitutional Changes of Government in Africa

description.narrative: To provide analysis and policy recommendations to the key stakeholders on governance challenges particularly on the Unconstitutional Changes of Government

title.narrative: Conference organized for key stakeholders and policy makers

comment.narrative: The ISS at the request of the AU commission participated in the reflection forum on Unconstitutional Changes of Government. The objective of the forum was aimed at reflecting on the challenge(s) posed by unconstitutional changes of government, their structural triggers on the continent and recommendations moving forward.

title.narrative: Enhanced understanding and response capacity for African Ambassadors in different AU missions on global dynamics on peace and security and the implications on Africa

description.narrative: To provide analysis to key decision makers on the implications of the new EU's funding mechanism to peace and security in Africa

title.narrative: Consultations held and key recommendations shared

comment.narrative: The ISS organized a closed Ambassadors briefing targeting the different AU missions in Addis Ababa, Brussels and New York. The objective of the meeting was to discuss the New EU's financing approach to peace operations and the implications this has on peace and security on the continent

title.narrative: Enhanced understanding and capacity building for technical experts on collaboration on issues of governance and security on the continent

description.narrative: To provide analysis to key decision makers to enhance their understanding, collaboration and response capacities on governance and security issues

title.narrative: Retreat organized for AU Technical Experts

comment.narrative: ISS jointly with UNDP organized a retreat for the AU technical experts. The objective was to provide an opportunity for the technical experts of to discuss and reflect on the various dimensions of AU’s multiple partnerships and the existing challenges in relation to governance, peace and security.

title.narrative: Enhanced understanding of policy makers and key stakeholders on the transition in South Sudan

description.narrative: To provide analysis to key stakeholders and policy makers on the transition in South Sudan and the expectations moving forward

title.narrative: Public seminars organized for key stakeholders and policy makers

comment.narrative: The ISS organized an open webinar looking at the transition in South Sudan. The objective of the webinar was to look at how the transition in South Sudan is fairing and what needs to achieved in 2022 as well as a platform that facilitated the launching of the ISS report on “South Sudan’s transitional government: realities, challenges and opportunities

title.narrative: Informed broad based understanding of policy makers on the future prospects of the Horn of Africa

description.narrative: To provide analysis to policy makers on the future prospects of the Horn of Africa and policy options moving forward

title.narrative: Public seminars organized for key stakeholders and policy makers

comment.narrative: ISS jointly with the AFI team, organized an open webinar looking at the future prospects of the Horn. The objective of the webinar was to discuss the human and economic development prospects for the Horn countries as well as a platform to Launch the ISS report on “ Development prospects for the Horn of Africa countries to 2020”.

title.narrative: Informed broad base understanding on the EU-AU peace and security partnership

description.narrative: To provide analysis to the diplomatic community and other key stakeholders, AU's multi-lateral engagements with the EU on peace and security , institutional challenges and way forward for cooperation.

title.narrative: Public seminars organized for key stakeholders and policy makers

comment.narrative: ISS jointly with ECDPM organized a webinar ahead of the EU-AU summit.The objective of the webinar was to deliberate on the key agenda issues of the EU-AU summit and the expectations particularly on the peace and security partnership

title.narrative: Informed broad based understanding of Policy Makers on African Union's multilateral engagements

description.narrative: To provide analysis to the diplomatic community and other key stakeholders, AU's multi-lateral engagements, institutional challenges and way forward for cooperation.

title.narrative: Public seminars organized for key stakeholders and policy makers

comment.narrative: ISS organized an open webinar on AU's multilateral engagements..

title.narrative: Enhanced understanding and capacity building for East African Community policymakers on the security and governance dynamics in the East African region

description.narrative: To provide capacity buiding for the way forward towards achieving peace and stability in the East African region through diplomatic efforts.

title.narrative: Capacity building for Regional Economic Communities (RECS)

comment.narrative: ISS organized a capacity building workshop for East African Community Ambassadors based in Addis, with the objective of improving and identifying entry-points for stabilisation and discussing ways of enhancing cooperation at the regional and continental levels on issues of governance and security

title.narrative: Enhanced understanding and capacity buidling for Kenyan policymakers and diplomats (Embassy staff) in Addis on the dynamics of governance, peace and security in the Horn of Africa.

description.narrative: To provide capacity buiding for the way forward towards achieving peace and stability in the Horn of Africa through diplomatic efforts.

title.narrative: Capacity Building for member states

comment.narrative: ISS organized a capacity building workshop for the Kenyan Embassy in Addis, looking at Kenya's role in attaining peace and stability in the Horn of Africa.

title.narrative: Enhanced understanding of the AU PSC Committee of Experts on Conflict Analysis

description.narrative: To provide capacity building for the AU PSC Committee of Experts on Conflict Analysis as well as in the drafting of documents relevant to their work.

title.narrative: Technical Support to the AU PSC Committee of Experts

comment.narrative: The ISS at the request of the AU PSC secretariat provided capacity building to the Committee of Experts on Conflict Analysis. The objective of the training was to build the institutional capacity of the PSC Committee of Experts on Conflict Analysis and the drafting of PSC documents.

title.narrative: Enhanced understanding and capacity building for African Defence Attachés on peace and security dynamics on the continent

description.narrative: To provide exchange of information and updates on key dynamics of peace and security on the Continent

title.narrative: Retreat organized for African Defence Attachés

comment.narrative: The ISS organized a retreat for the African Defence Attachés. The objective was to provide the DA's with an opportunity to exchange information among themselves as well as be updated on key dynamics on peace and security on the continent.

title.narrative: Informed broad base understanding on Women Peace and Security issues

description.narrative: To provide inputs and recommendations to policy makers on Women Peace and Security

title.narrative: consultations held and key recommendations shared

comment.narrative: The ISS together with the IPSS organized a joint consultation on Women Peace and Security; focusing on the challemges implementation of resolution 1325
The ISS together with the IPSS organized a joint consultation on Women Peace and Security; focusing on the challemges implementation of resolution 1325

title.narrative: Increased knowledge base on silencing the guns initiative

description.narrative: To provide research based knowledge to key stakeholders on silencing the guns initiative

title.narrative: public seminars organised for key stakeholders and policymakers

comment.narrative: Organized three (3) open webinars on the silencing the guns initiative; the first focusing on the role of amnesties in silencing the guns; the second webinar was based on the monograph " Silecning the guns, achievements, opportunities and challenges; and the third focused on , does silencing the guns have a future beyond 2020.

Organized three (3) open webinars on the silencing the guns initiative; the first focusing on the role of amnesties in silencing the guns; the second webinar was based on the monograph " Silecning the guns, achievements, opportunities and challenges; and the third focused on , does silencing the guns have a future beyond 2020.

title.narrative: Informed policy reflections on ways of crafting a continental report on the state of peace and security in Africa

description.narrative: To provide technical support and capacity building for developing a continental report on the state of peace and security in Africa

title.narrative: Capacity Building for the AU Commission

comment.narrative: ISS contributed to the reflections on the crafting of a continental report on the state of peace and security in Africa

title.narrative: Induction retreat for the AU PSC members

description.narrative: To provide technical support and capacity building for the newly elected PSC members on the working methods and an analysis of the emerging threats to peace and security on the continent

title.narrative: Technical Support to the AU

comment.narrative: The ISS at the request of the AU PSC secretariat participated in the induction of the new PSC members as well as provided training for the Commitee of Experts on conflict analysis. The objective of this induction and training was to enhance the understanding of the PSC on the working methods as well as enhance PSC working relations with other key stakeholders, particularly CSOs and think tanks working on the African Union

title.narrative: Enhanced policy understanding of the state of organised crime in the Africa, the nature of responses by member states and Africa's performance in comparison with other parts of the world.

description.narrative: To provide technical support and capacity building in understanding the state of organized crime in Africa.

title.narrative: Capacity Building for AU Commission

comment.narrative: The ISS jointly with the ENACT team organized a roundtable for the AU PSC secretariat to discuss the organized crime index and its usefulness on the continent.

comment.narrative: The ISS jointly with the AGA-APSA secretariat organized a validation workshop for key internal AU stakeholders to reflect on the draft Guidance Note and fine tune the document before its submision to the Commissioner, Political Affairs, Peace and Security (PAPS)

title.narrative: Publication on key peace and security issue in Africa

comment.narrative: Policy publications on key peace and security issues in Africa

The ISS team authored two major publications on key issues on the continent (1) addressing the challenge of the abuse of incumbency during elections and, (2) the achievements of the silencing the guns initiative in Africa. (3) Contribution to the study of effectiveness of UNAMID.

title.narrative: public seminars organised for the wider Addis Ababa policy community

comment.narrative: seminars successfully organised and attendance averaging 80-100 people.
Organised two seminars on the margins of the AU Summit 33, as well as 4 Webinars on the impact of COVID on governance, peace and Security issues.
